Ok, fixed code. And i typed the code from the top of my head. I usually don’t type up the code in the reply box, but i was too lazy to open up my IDE. Also, i don’t follow Indentation rules really. I usually add a line and an additional tab to the next line.

item.title: ::pure
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:253202”]Full Metalst, the code you provided, meant that you had to manually 14000000 xp in each skill. Where as the code he posted utilized a for loop, which greatly reduces the lines of code to about 10 max. for the ::pure command, do this:

[code]
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“pure”))
{
for(int i = 0; i < 21; i++)
{
addSkillXP(14000000, i);

            if(i == 2 || i == 5)//Pulled numbers from P16 source of mine(been a long time since i touched this ^_^)
                {
                    continue;
                }
        }
}[/code][/quote]

Uh, you’re using the continue statement too late in the loop.
Also, you shouldn’t indent brackets below statements, that doesn’t look nice. =\

Edit: Yeah, that looks better.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pure
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Full Metalst, the code you provided, meant that you had to manually 14000000 xp in each skill. Where as the code he posted utilized a for loop, which greatly reduces the lines of code to about 10 max. for the ::pure command, do this:

[code]
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“pure”)) {
for(int i = 0; i < 21; i++) {
if(i == 2 || i == 5) {//Pulled numbers from P16 source of mine(been a long time since i touched this ^_^)
continue;
}

 addSkillXP(14000000, i);
}

}[/code]

EDIT: Fixed code

Read full topic

@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

0 is attack, 1 is defence, 2 is strength, 3 is hitpoints, 4 is range, 5 is prayer and 6 is magic if I recall correctly, and I’m almost certain I do.

item.title: ::pure
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Full Metalst, post:3, topic:253202”]zyle, he’s asking how he’d make a command from it from addSkillXP. Something like this:

if (command.startsWith("pure") && (playerRights >= 2)) { addSkillXP(1, 14000000); addSkillXP(2, 14000000); sendMessage("You're now a pure!") }

I think 4 and 5 are Defense and Prayer, so don’t put 4 and 5. Try that.[/quote]
Well, I understand what Zyle was saying.
He meant that you can make the loop skip over the two unwanted skills - defence and prayer (which are actually 1 and 5, I believe) - using a continue statement.

Read full topic
